00045 #ifdef WIN32
00046 const char __egs_fs = 92;
00047 #else
00048 const char __egs_fs = '/';

00057 bool EGS_EXPORT egsStoreI64(ostream &data, EGS_I64 n) {
00058     EGS_I64 i1 = n; i1 /= 1000000000; EGS_I64 i2 = n % 1000000000;
00059     data << " " << (int) i1 << " " << (int) i2;
00060     if( data.fail() ) return false;
00061     return true;
00062 }
00063 
00064 bool EGS_EXPORT egsGetI64(istream &data, EGS_I64 &n) {
00065     int i1, i2; data >> i1 >> i2;
00066     if( data.eof() || !data.good() ) return false;
00067     n = i1; n *= 1000000000; n += i2;
00068     return true;
00069 }

00071 static FILE *egs_info_fp = stdout;
00072 static FILE *egs_warning_fp = stderr;
00073 static FILE *egs_error_fp = stderr;
00074 
00075 static EGS_LOCAL char __egsf_write_buf[8192];
00076 
00077 static void EGS_LOCAL __egs_default_information(const char *msg, ...) {
00078     va_list ap; va_start( ap, msg );
00079     EGS_Application *a = EGS_Application::activeApplication();
00080     if( a ) {
00081         vsprintf(__egsf_write_buf,msg,ap); a->appInformation(__egsf_write_buf);
00082     }
00083     else {
00084         vfprintf( egs_info_fp, msg, ap ); fflush(egs_info_fp);
00085     }
00086     va_end(ap);
00087 }
00088 
00089 static void EGS_LOCAL __egs_default_warning(const char *msg, ...) {
00090     va_list ap; va_start( ap, msg );
00091     EGS_Application *a = EGS_Application::activeApplication();
00092     if( a ) {
00093         vsprintf(__egsf_write_buf,msg,ap); a->appWarning(__egsf_write_buf);
00094     }
00095     else {
00096 
00097         vfprintf( egs_warning_fp, msg, ap ); fflush(egs_warning_fp);
00098     }
00099     va_end(ap);
00100 }
00101 
00102 static void EGS_LOCAL __egs_default_error(const char *msg, ...) {
00103     va_list ap; va_start( ap, msg );
00104     EGS_Application *a = EGS_Application::activeApplication();
00105     if( a ) {
00106         vsprintf(__egsf_write_buf,msg,ap); va_end(ap);
00107         a->appFatal(__egsf_write_buf);
00108     }
00109     else {
00110         vfprintf( egs_error_fp, msg, ap ); fflush(stderr);
00111         va_end(ap); exit(1);
00112     }
00113 }
00114 
00115 EGS_InfoFunction EGS_EXPORT egsInformation = __egs_default_information;
00116 EGS_InfoFunction EGS_EXPORT egsWarning = __egs_default_warning;
00117 EGS_InfoFunction EGS_EXPORT egsFatal = __egs_default_error;
00118 
00119 EGS_InfoFunction egsSetInfoFunction(EGS_InfoType t, EGS_InfoFunction func) {
00120     if( !func ) {
00121         egsWarning("egsSetInfoFunction: info function can not be NULL!\n");
00122         return 0;
00123     }
00124     EGS_InfoFunction res;
00125     switch (t) {
00126         case Information: res = egsInformation; egsInformation = func; break;
00127         case Warning: res = egsWarning; egsWarning = func; break;
00128         case Fatal: res = egsFatal; egsFatal = func; break;
00129         default: egsWarning("Unknown info function type\n"); res = 0;
00130     }
00131     return res;
00132 }
00133 
00134 void egsSetDefaultIOFunctions() {
00135     egsInformation = __egs_default_information;
00136     egsWarning = __egs_default_warning;
00137     egsFatal = __egs_default_error;
00138 }

00140 template <class T> void __egs_swap_bytes(T *v) {
00141     char *c = (char *) v;
00142     char tmp = c[0]; c[0]=c[3]; c[3]=tmp;
00143     tmp = c[1]; c[1]=c[2]; c[2]=tmp;
00144 }
00145 
00146 void egsSwapBytes(int *n) { __egs_swap_bytes<int>(n); }
00147 void egsSwapBytes(float *n) { __egs_swap_bytes<float>(n); }
00148 
00149 void egsSwapBytes(short *n) {
00150     char *c = (char *) n;
00151     char tmp=c[0]; c[0]=c[1]; c[1]=tmp;
00152 }

00154 string egsJoinPath(const string &first, const string &second) {
00155     int n = first.size()-1; char c = first[n];
00156     string result(first);
00157     if( c == '/' && c != __egs_fs ) result[n] = __egs_fs;
00158     if( result[n] != __egs_fs ) result += __egs_fs;
00159     result += second;
00160     return result;
00161 }
00162 
00163 string egsStripPath(const string &aname) {
00164     int j;
00165     for(j=aname.size()-1; j>=0; j--) {
00166         if( aname[j] == '/' || aname[j] == __egs_fs ) { j++; break; }
00167     }
00168     if( j < 0 ) return aname;
00169     string result;
00170     if( j >= 0 ) {
00171         while( j < aname.size() ) result += aname[j++];
00172     }
00173     return result;
00174 }

00183 string egsHostName() {
00184 #ifdef WIN32
00185     // Windows has the gethostname() function but it only works after
00186     // calling WSAStartup and in addition we have to link against the
00187     // ws2_32 DLL. This is pretty stupid as we just want to get the host name =>
00188     // we try to get the host name from environment variables.
00189     char *var = getenv("COMPUTERNAME");
00190     if( !var ) {
00191         var = getenv("HOSTNAME");
00192         if( !var ) var = getenv("HOST");
00193     }
00194     if( !var ) return "unknown";
00195     return var;
00196 #else
00197     char buf[1024];
00198     int err = gethostname(buf,1023);
00199     if( err ) return "unknown";
00200     return buf;
00201 #endif
00202 }
00203 
00204 int egsGetPid() {
00205 #ifdef WIN32
00206     return _getpid();
00207 #else
00208     return getpid();
00209 #endif
00210 }

00212 string egsSimplifyCVSKey(const string &key) {
00213     if( key.size() < 2 ) return key;
00214     int js; for(js=0; js<key.size(); js++) if( key[js] == '$' ) break;
00215     if( js >= key.size() ) return key;
00216     int je; for(je=key.size()-1; je>=0; je--) if( key[je] == '$' ) break;
00217     if( je <= js ) return key;
00218     string result; for(int j=js+1; j<je; j++) result += key[j];
00219     return result;
00220 }
00221 
00222 int egsGetEndian() {
00223     int nl = 0x12345678; unsigned char *p = (unsigned char *)(&nl);
00224     if ( p[0] == 0x12 && p[1] == 0x34 && p[2] == 0x56 && p[3] == 0x78 )
00225         return 0;
00226     if ( p[0] == 0x78 && p[1] == 0x56 && p[2] == 0x34 && p[3] == 0x12 )
00227         return 1;
00228     return -1;
00229 }
00230 
00231 bool egsIsAbsolutePath(const string &path) {
00232 #ifdef WIN32
00233     if( path.size() < 2 ) return false;
00234     if( (path[0] == '/' || path[0] == __egs_fs) &&
00235         (path[1] == '/' || path[1] == __egs_fs) ) return true;
00236     if( path.size() < 3 ) return false;
00237     if( !isalpha(path[0]) ) return false;
00238     if( path[1] != ':' ) return false;
00239     if( path[2] != '/' && path[2] != __egs_fs ) return false;
00240     return true;
00241 #else
00242     return (path[0] == '/');
00243 #endif
00244 }
